entry.title: Tove Birkelund (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Danish geologist Tove Birkelund (pictured) received a gold medal for her early work on fossils of Scaphites in Greenland?

entry.title: Made You Look (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Meghan Trainor was inspired to write "Made You Look" after her therapist asked her to look at herself naked for five minutes?

entry.title: the tomb of a medieval Polish king (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that of 12 experts who opened the tomb of a medieval Polish king in 1973, 10 died prematurely?

entry.title: Vogelsang Pass (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the view from Vogelsang Pass has been described as "one of the most stunning" in Yosemite National Park?

entry.title: Radoje Pajović (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Montenegrin historian Radoje Pajović refused to engage in historical revisionism to rehabilitate Chetniks who collaborated with the Axis powers?

entry.title: Great Bear (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the roller coaster Great Bear is named after the constellation Ursa Major?

entry.title: War Memorial Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Belfast's War Memorial Building was built on the site of a hotel destroyed during the 1941 Belfast Blitz?

entry.title: Shigeo Kageyama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shigeo Kageyama was purposely created to come across as "somewhat standoffish or nerdy"?
